title: Application of Multimedia Learning Neurological Mechanisms and Design Principles

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of core concepts and intermediate-level application skills
context.additional_context: A course focused on applying neuroscience-based multimedia design theories to actual instructional design, understanding learning effectiveness verification methods through EEG data analysis cases

learning_goals: Learners can explain five multimedia design principles and analyze their correlation with learning effectiveness
Regional information processing efficiency can be evaluated through EEG-based brain network analysis
Cognitive load changes due to multimedia design can be predicted using modularity analysis
The correlation between adherence to design principles and brain network characteristics (hub formation, local/global processing) can be interpreted
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
